main event: A bright object was observed low on the horizon in Bangor, Maine on February 25, 1959.
interesting points: The object was described as large and bright, similar in size to a grapefruit., The observation lasted for 5 minutes., Witnesses were uncertain if the object was a balloon or another type of aircraft., The sighting occurred shortly after a possible sighting of Jupiter., The object's movement was described as slow, appearing to move both up and down.
witness description: A1C Richard, 406th Headquarters, Base Police, Dow AFB
